name: Primary Math Lesson
description: Standard template for primary school mathematics lessons with objectives, activities, and assessment
content:
# Math Lesson Plan Template

## Learning Objectives
- Students will understand [concept]
- Students will be able to [skill]

## Materials Needed
- Whiteboard and markers
- Worksheets
- Manipulatives

## Lesson Structure

### Introduction (10 minutes)
- Review previous lesson
- Introduce new concept

### Main Activity (30 minutes)
- Guided practice
- Independent work

### Conclusion (10 minutes)
- Summarize key points
- Preview next lesson

## Assessment
- Formative assessment during activities
- Exit ticket

## Homework
- Practice worksheets

name: Science Experiment Report
description: Template for documenting science experiments with hypothesis, methodology, and conclusions
content:
# Science Experiment Report

## Experiment Title
[Title of the experiment]

## Hypothesis
I predict that [prediction] because [reasoning].

## Materials
- [List all materials needed]
- [Include quantities where relevant]

## Procedure
1. [Step-by-step instructions]
2. [Include safety considerations]
3. [Be specific and clear]

## Observations
### Data Collection
[Tables, charts, or written observations]

### Results
[What happened during the experiment]

## Analysis
[Explanation of results]

## Conclusion
[Was hypothesis correct? What was learned?]

## Further Questions
[What would you investigate next?]

name: Reading Comprehension Worksheet
description: Interactive worksheet template for developing reading comprehension skills with various question types
content:
# Reading Comprehension Worksheet

## Student Name: ________________  Date: ________________

## Reading Passage
[Insert age-appropriate reading passage here]

## Comprehension Questions

### Multiple Choice
1. What is the main idea of the passage?
   a) [Option A]
   b) [Option B]
   c) [Option C]
   d) [Option D]

### Short Answer
2. Who are the main characters in the story?
   ________________________________

3. When does the story take place?
   ________________________________

### Extended Response
4. Explain how the main character solved their problem. Use evidence from the text to support your answer.
   ________________________________
   ________________________________
   ________________________________

### Critical Thinking
5. Do you agree with the character's decision? Why or why not?
   ________________________________
   ________________________________

## Vocabulary
Define the following words from the passage:
- [Word 1]: ________________________________
- [Word 2]: ________________________________
- [Word 3]: ________________________________
